item.title: Flood alert: Wye Estuary in Gloucestershire
item.description: A flood alert has been issued as a result of an upcoming period of high tides. Tides will be at their highest between 20:45 today, 08/09/25 and 21:45 Wednesday, 10/09/25. Flooding to roads and low lying land adjacent the Wye Estuary from Redbrook to Chepstow is expected at the times of high tides, however conditions may apply a few hours either side of the high tides. Predicted peaks at Newport 7.2m at 20:45 on 08/09 and 7.1m at 09:00 on 09/09. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 13:00 on 09/09/25, or as the situation changes.
